definition: word (general term including monosyllables through to short phrases)/term (e.g. technical term)/expression
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
vocabulary words (in language-learning books)/new or unfamiliar words

sentences.english: The four-letter words were always edited out of radio scripts until quite recently.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近广播稿中的庸俗词语才让保留下来。

sentences.english: "Small" is a subjective term, so a "small" release depends upon your definition.
sentences.chinese: “小”是一个主观性的词语，取决于您的定义。

sentences.english: "Ubuntu" is an ancient African word that means "humanity to others".
sentences.chinese: “乌班图”是古非洲词语，意思是“与人分享”。

sentences.english: The languages of Denmark and Norway both have similar words.
sentences.chinese: 在丹麦和挪威语中也有类似的词语。

sentences.english: Except for the repetition, there are 2168 words.
"White Valentine's Day" originated Rome of three jerkins at the earliest stage.
sentences.chinese: “白禁用词语人节”最早起源于三世纪时的罗马。

sentences.english: In French, words are either masculine or feminine, singular or plural.
sentences.chinese: 在法语中，词语有阴阳性和单复数的变化。

sentences.english: The painting rises from the brushstrokes as a poem rises from the words.
sentences.chinese: 绘画出自于笔刷正如诗歌出自于词语。

sentences.english: Antinomianism is derived from two Greek words ("anti" and "nomos") that literally mean "against the law.
sentences.chinese: 反律法主义来源于两个希腊词语，义为“反对律法”。

sentences.english: Words like that can be a form of overcompensation.
sentences.chinese: 这样的词语可能是一种过度补偿的形式。

sentences.english: Which of the following phrases means to glace left and right?
sentences.chinese: 指向左右两边看的词语是下面哪一个呢？

sentences.english: Now write sentences in the past tense from the following prompts.
sentences.chinese: 仿照示例，用过去时将所给词语连接成句。

sentences.english: Are the words you use uplifting or devastating?
sentences.chinese: 你用的词语是成事还是败事？

sentences.english: It has also illustrated through the typical examples the concrete usage of the deixis in the deictic context.
sentences.chinese: 通过典例说明了在指示语境中指示词语的具体用法。

sentences.english: You may have to talk yourself out of uttering negative words.
sentences.chinese: 你可能要说服自己放弃使用绝对消极的词语。

sentences.english: "Vocalise" is a song in which words would truly be superfluous.
sentences.chinese: 交流如果是可能的，所有的词语应该都是多余的。

definition: vocabulary/list of words (e.g. for language teaching purposes)/word
variant of 詞彙|词汇[ci2 hui4]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
Chinese set expression, typically of 4 characters, often alluding to a story or historical quotation/idiom/proverb/saying/adage/CL:條|条[tiao2],本[ben3],句[ju4]
